question.text: In which of the following method of biodiversity conservation, tracts of forest are set aside, and all the trees and wildlife within are venerated and given total protection?

solution.text: India has also a history of religious and cultural traditions that emphasize the protection of nature. In many cultures, tracts of forest were set aside, and all the trees and wildlife within were venerated and given total protection. Such sacred groves are found in Khasi and Jaintia hills in Meghalaya, Aravalli hills of Rajasthan, Western Ghat regions of Karnataka and Maharashtra and the Sarguja, Chanda and Bastar areas of Madhya Pradesh. In Meghalaya, the sacred groves are the last refuges for a large number of rare and threatened plants.
